Web guides

Offers all available guides that can help you as you develop and design your website. Included are guides that can be used for the Base theme and mandatory guides for developing in the Canada.ca theme.

Canada.ca guides

Visit the Canada.ca design guide for information about design.

Design guide

This is where you learn about the basic CSS design for Web elements which can be used in the Base theme.

Writing guide

The principles every content creator must know before writing content made for the Web. The writing standards that ensure content adheres to specific technical writing requirements.

Accessibility guide

The accessibility guide provides content authors and webmasters with an understanding of how to create and code content that is accessible to all users, regardless of ability or disability.

Usability guide

The usability guide provides content authors and webmasters with an understanding of how user behaviour impacts whether content is useable or not.

Content findability guide

The most important blind visitor to your website is Google! In the same way that creating accessible web pages helps a disabled person to access your content, it also helps Google index your pages so that the right people can find your service or product.

Implementation guide

Configure Custom HTTP Headers to emit "X-UA-Compatible" "IE-Edge". Instructions on configuring IIS (English/French) or Apache (English/French) can be found on MSDN.

Github guide

For beginners, intermediates and even experts! Here is where you can find all the important information you need when developing with WET on Github.
